cpt-2.human: A system is required if a value is provided.

use.requirements: Need to track the way a person uses this contact, so a user can choose which is appropriate for their purpose.
use.short: home | work | temp | old | mobile - purpose of this contact point
use.definition: Identifies the purpose for the contact point.
use.comment: Applications can assume that a contact is current unless it explicitly says that it is temporary or old.

rank.short: Specify preferred order of use (1 = highest)
rank.comment: Note that rank does not necessarily follow the order in which the contacts are represented in the instance.
rank.definition: Specifies a preferred order in which to use a set of contacts. ContactPoints with lower rank values are more preferred than those with higher rank values.

value.comment: Additional text data such as phone extension numbers, or notes about use of the contact are sometimes included in the value.
value.definition: The actual contact point details, in a form that is meaningful to the designated communication system (i.e. phone number or email address).
value.requirements: Need to support legacy numbers that are not in a tightly controlled format.

period.short: Time period when the contact point was/is in use
period.definition: Time period when the contact point was/is in use.

system.short: phone | fax | email | pager | url | sms | other
system.definition: Telecommunications form for contact point - what communications system is required to make use of the contact.
